Four kinds of illness for those gone for: Having many wishes, being frustrated, and not being content with any kind of robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick
Focusing corrupt wishes on being looked up to, and on getting material possessions, honor, and popularity
Trying hard, striving, and making an effort to get these things
Having an ulterior motive when they visit families, sit down, speak on Dhamma, and even when they hold it in when they need to go to the toilet
The training to overcome the four kinds: Not having many wishes or being frustrated
Being content with any kind of robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick
Not focusing corrupt wishes on being looked up to, and on getting material possessions, honor, and popularity
Not trying hard, striving, and making an effort to get these things
Enduring cold, heat, hunger, and thirst
Enduring the touch of flies, mosquitoes, wind, sun, and reptiles
